info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 10:11PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Arapahoe, Denver, northern Jefferson and southwestern Adams Counties through 1100 PM MDT... At 1010 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southwestern Lakewood, or 12 miles west of Denver, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Denver, western Aurora, Lakewood, southern Thornton, southeastern Arvada, southern Westminster, northern Centennial, western Commerce City, northeastern Littleton, eastern Northglenn, Englewood, Wheat Ridge, southeastern Golden, Greenwood Village, Evergreen, Federal Heights, Sheridan, Morrison, Idledale and Tiny Town. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for northeastern Colorado.
